data.title: Boston Celtics' Amir Johnson expected to play in USA Basketball Showcase
data.meta_description: Boston Celtics big man Amir Johnson will participate in the USA Basketball Showcase Thursday night in Las Vegas, according to an official press release about the event.
data.text:
Perry Jones, David Lee, Amir Johnson, Jae Crowder, Jonas Jerebko

Boston Celtics basketball players, from left, Perry Jones, David Lee, Amir Johnson, Jae Crowder, and Jonas Jerebko, display team jerseys during a news conference at the NBA team's training facility Monday, July 27, 2015, in Waltham, Mass.

(AP Photo/Steven Senne)

Boston Celtics big man Amir Johnson will participate in the USA Basketball Showcase Thursday night in Las Vegas, according to an official press release about the event.

Because Team USA won't compete in any international competitions this summer, the scrimmage was considered "voluntary and not a requirement," according to USA Basketball chairman and national team managing director Jerry Colangelo. As such, many players on the roster for Team USA's mini-camp this week will not participate in the event.

To fill out the rosters for the showcase, Johnson was one of five players invited for just the scrimmage. The others were C.J. Watson, Arron Afflalo, Elfrid Payton and Terrence Jones. The additions may have been at least partially determined by proximity to the game. Johnson lives in Las Vegas, and Watson and Afflalo reportedly do too.
